snippet: In a rare move, Blue Bell recalled all its ice cream and other products after a succession of smaller recalls failed.
abstract: Blue Bell Creameries, nation's third-largest ice cream brand, recalls all of its frozen desserts and shuts registers at all 300 of its stores due to potential listeria contamination; rapid pace of recall highlights seriousness of threat, and represents biggest crisis in brand's 108-year history; some analysts say despite rare urgency and scope of recall, Blue Bell acted too late to prevent erosion of customer confidence.

byline.original: By RACHEL ABRAMS and HIROKO TABUCHI

lead_paragraph: In a rare move, Blue Bell recalled all its ice cream and other products after a succession of smaller recalls failed.

headline.main: For Blue Bell, a Drastic Move to Recall Ice Cream as Listeria Findings Rose
headline.print_headline: Listeria Leads to Major Ice Cream Recall
